Genial
It's awesome. It's classic. It's PORTAL. What more is there to say?

Woke up to timer and music.
Test lady told me to do some things.
Got a portal gun.
Completed some tests.
Killiing machines with low self esteem don't hate me.
I fell in love with a cube that would never threaten to stab me.
Mean test lady almost killed me.
Almost died in a fire.
The cake was a lie.
Mean test lady told me I would go to a party.
I didn't listen to her.
I trudged through the sewers.
I got to the mean test lady`s central chamber.
She tried to kill me with neurotoxin.
I slowly destroyed the mean test lady.
Everything exploded.
I assumed the party escort position.
The cube that would never threaten to stab me came back to me.
Got some cake.

9/10
the cake was a lie.

[b]It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.[/b]
Portal is a brilliant game. You assume the role of a test subject named Chell in the Aperture Science Enrichment Centre being guided by an AI named GLaDOS through a series of deadly test chambers testing an experimental portal device. 
Portal is a puzzle game with the test chambers acting as the puzzles using physics and portals to solve them. Portal's puzzles are very well thought out to the point that they are challenging but not impossibly hard. The game is short but sweet leaving you wishing it lasted longer but is still 110% worth it.
I would definitly recommend Portal to absolutly anybody with a computer being the short but brilliantly detailed game it is. If you didn't understand the joke at the start of this review then you are playing the wrong games.
[b]10/10[/b]
This game was pretty fun to play through. The gameplay is intuitive, the level design is creative, and I had a blast listening to some of the dialogue courtesy of glaDOs

"С сожалением сообщаем, что следующее испытание непроходимо. Даже не пытайтесь искать решение!" – ох уж этот ГЛэДОС. Забавный компьютерный голос, который сопровождает нас во время прохождения.

Интересная игра с отличными головоломками! Хоть и сюжет маленький, но очень интересный и необычный!

Сможешь ли ты пройти все испытания и остаться в живых? Всё в твоих руках.

Одна из немногих игр которая сочетает в себе и классное управление, великолепны дизайн, и умтсвенное напряжение.

What could be better than a first person shooter turned puzzle game that challenges both your wit and your reflexes?
Oh, give it a strong protagonist, an intruiging and sinister villian, and a compelling story. That.
What I really enjoy about this game is that it doesn't take the story and smash you over the head with it in wall after wall of painful exposition. Some things are spelled out by GlaDos while others you come across and have to piece together for yourself. The game trusts you to figure out what's going on and I appreciate that. Especially after dying on the same level in the same way eight times in a row. It makes me feel al little better about myself.
GlaDos is quite possibly the best video game villian ever written. She's funny and terrifying at the same time, like that one aunt everyone avoids at the family christmas party. They could have easily hammed her up and gone overboard with it but somehow managed to find the perfect balance between cold emotionless android and snarky embittered librarian.
The puzzels are challenging, but do-able. There is always a solution even though it is not always obvious. Keep at it and solving the tests becomes almost addicting. Once you get to post game and start the challenges it's even worse.
The game is very brief and when you play the second game you discover it only barely scrapes the surface of the Portal world, but I feel like that's fair for a game that was released in a bundle with two other games. It's more like an animated short than a box office movie, but you more than get what you pay for.
Seriously, you just need to play it. It is SO GOOD.

It's a great game, but like negative reviews say, it's short. But it's part of the story, so I think this shouldn't be left out.

Pros:
- Story, likely like intro for Portal 2
- The idea; unique, this game brought so much, without this we wouldn't have Portal 2 and therefore not fanart, fan vids, fan mods to other games etc.
- It's one of the greatest puzzle games, little bit easy but it's good
- Speedrunning, see the speedrun vids, this game is pretty decent for it.
- Color theme is beautiful, there's so few games with only white, brings the unique exprience this way as well.

Cons:
- Short

Conclusion: Only one con, but shouldn't be ignored. I recommended to buy in sales / bundle, you can see the price / hour.

[h1]Portal[/h1]

Został wydany w 2007 roku przez Valve Corporation. Jest to logiczno-platformowa gra ukazana z perspektywy pierwszej osoby.

Silnik fizyczny gry jest bardzo dobrze zaprogramowany. Interakcja z otoczeniem jest na tyle duża, że wprowadza złudne odczucie posiadania duszy przez każdy, nawet najmniejszy element. Grafika jest dopracowana i idealnie oddaje klimat gry. Muzyka wprowadza nas w laboratoryjny klimat panujący podczas rozgrywki. Fabuła jest dość interesująca, lecz nie jest mocną stroną Portala.

Bohaterka gry o imieniu Chell budzi się w komorze relaksacyjnej jednego z pomieszczeń obiektu badawczego Aperture Sience Enrichment. Po paru sekundach wita ją sztuczna inteligencja - GLaDOS władająca całym kompleksem. Informuje ona główną postać o konieczności przeprowadzenia specjalnych testów. W jednym z nich otrzymuje broń, dzięki której tworzy portale. Ostatni test ma się zakończyć doszczętnym spaleniem obiektu testowego, którym jest Chell, jednak udaje się jej uciec. Przedziera się przez biura pracowników i korytarze pełne zabezpieczeń do samego serca sztucznej inteligencji. Dowiadujemy się, że GLaDOS zabiła wszystkich pracowników neurotoksyną. Poprzez wykorzystanie broni tworzącej portale oraz działka rakietowego, Chell niszczy superkomputer i ląduje na powierzchni parkingowej przed kompleksem. Ponieważ bohaterka nieszczęśliwie leżała w uległej pozycji została zaciągnięta przez wędrującego za nią eskortującego robota spowrotem do obiektu wypoczynkowego w Enrichment Center.

Reasumując, do plusów gry możemy zaliczyć:
- poprawność w sferze fabularnej
- możliwość rozwiązywania zagadek z pomocą broni tworzącej portale
- silnik fizyczny
- grafikę
- pokonywanie przeszkód
- konieczność logicznego myślenia 
- poziom trudności.

Natomiast do ewidentnych minusów trzeba zaliczyć:
- wybitnie krótki czas potrzebny do zakończenia wątku głównego
- zbyt wygórowana cena, jak na niecałe trzy godziny dobrej zabawy.

Moim zdaniem, Portal nie jest tytułem godnym polecenia ze względu na znaczące minusy gry.

Très bon jeu qui demande de réfléchir,

le but du jeu est de résoudre des énigmes simple mais complexe dans l'exécution, en utilisant un fusil de téléportation, vous êtes une femelle surement une clone utilisé par une machinne pour ces test sur les humains, donc si vous mourrer, ce n'est pas grave, une autre prendra sa place à l'endroit où vous êtes rendu,

Cette première version du jeu n'est pas longue, mais les tourelles parlante et la femelle robotisé font le charme du jeu, des cartes bonus ont été ajouté pour donner plus de mission, et elle sont beaucoup moins évidente à résoudre que les autres,

je ne suis généralement pas un fan des jeux de casse-tête mais juste le fait d'entendre les voix avec une certaine humour change tout, on est presque triste de devoir détruire les tourelles ha ha ha

bref, vous êtes une femelle (clone humaine) avec un foutu caractère qui refuse de laisser tomber contre une femelle robotisé avec un foutu caractère qui refuse de vous laisser gagné ha ha ha

et si vous gagné, un gâteau vous attend...

The pros: very well made game, original idea, the environment is pretty nice too,... But the best pro of all is that the AI voice is simply hilarious XD.

(SPOILERSSS) I quote: There was even going to be a party for you. A big party that all your friends were invited to. I invited your best friend, the Companion Cube. Of course, he couldn't come, because you murdered him. All your other friends couldn't come either, because you don't have any other friends. Because of how unlikeable you are. It says so here in your personnel file: unlikeable. Liked by no one. A bitter, unlikeable loner whose passing shall not be mourned. "Shall not be mourned." That's exactly what it says. Very formal. Very official. It also says you were adopted. So that's funny too.

F**k, just for the monologue of the AI, I'd play this game again a thousand times =P.


The only con: too short ! I finished the game in 3 hours (bonus maps excluded), I want more ! =D.

Every steam library should own this game (get Portal 2 as well if you can). ^.^

I'll finish by saying... the cake is not a lie !

I honestly hate puzzle games, but I loved Portal. It's not like any other puzzle game you'll play, and it has that classic Valve golden touch.

Portal. A game I would argue is one of the defining games of the 21st century. But, at times, it doesn't feel like a game. After all, it rewards you for breaking its own rules. Sure, GLaDOS tells you not to do that, but it's 100 times more fun to do it anyway just to spite her. And that is why Portal succeeds. It has great gameplay, contains shocking story depth for a game that only features two speaking characters, and, to top it all off, it's hilarious. Sure, it's a little short, especially when compared to Portal 2, but don't skip out on this game. See where it all started. You won't regret it.

With this game, you can have your cake and eat it, too. [spoiler]Except you can't.[/spoiler]
